SENT.plain: PURPOSE: Aplastic anemia (AA) is a rare hematologic disease characterized by pancytopenia and hypocellular marrow
The Korean Society of Pediatric Hematology Oncology investigated retrospectively the incidence, survival, and transfusion independency according to treatment strategies in AA
METHODS: All the questionnaires were sent to members for medical records
We collected and analyzed 702 available data
RESULTS: The male and female ratio was 1.2, and the median age at diagnosis was 9.3 years
The annual incidence of Korean children with AA was 5.16 per million per year
Constitutional anemia was diagnosed in 44 children
In acquired AA, causes were identified in 39 children
Severe AA (SAA) at initial diagnosis was more common than nonsevere AA
The overall survival was 47.8% with supportive care, 68.1% with immunosuppressive therapy (IST), and 81.8% with hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
In IST, response rate was 65.7%, and relapse rate after response was 54.4% within a median of 23.0 months

The factors with overall survival were severity of disease in supportive care, severity and response in IST, donor type, graft failure, and posttransplant events in hematopoietic stem cell transplantation
CONCLUSIONS: Long-term outcome in AA was dependent on treatment strategies
These Korean results may help research and prospective international clinical trials for childhood AA
